author: George Orwell
description: 1984 is a dystopian novella by George Orwell published in 1949, which follows the life of Winston Smith, a low ranking member of 'the Party', who is frustrated by the omnipresent eyes of the party, and its ominous ruler Big Brother. 'Big Brother' controls every aspect of people's lives.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The Lord of the Rings is the saga of a group of sometimes reluctant heroes who set forth to save their world from consummate evil. Its many worlds and creatures were drawn from Tolkien's extensive knowledge of philology and folklore

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: The novel examines a futuristic society, called the World State, that revolves around science and efficiency. In this society, emotions and individuality are conditioned out of children at a young age, and there are no lasting relationships because “every one belongs to every one else” (a common World State dictum).

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
description: A family heads to an isolated hotel for the winter where a sinister presence influences the father into violence, while his psychic son sees horrific forebodings from both past and future.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: A journalist is aided by a young female hacker in his search for the killer of a woman who has been dead for forty years. A journalist is aided by a young female hacker in his search for the killer of a woman who has been dead for forty years.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A classic novel about a young man's experiences in New York City.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A story of racial injustice and moral growth in the American South.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The classic tale of Bilbo Baggins' unexpected adventure.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A timeless love story set in the early 19th century.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story of decadence and the American Dream in the Roaring Twenties.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The start of the magical journey of a young wizard, Harry Potter.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical novel about a journey to find one's personal legend.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: A dystopian novel set in a post-apocalyptic world where teenagers compete in a deadly competition.
